description: Borrowed from Sanskrit मन्त्र (mantra, literally “instrument of thought”), from Proto-Indo-Aryan *mántram, from Proto-Indo-Iranian *mántram, from Proto-Indo-European *mén-tro-m, from *men- (“to think”). Doublet of mind.

entries.meaning: (Hinduism) The hymn portions of the Vedas; any passage of these used as a prayer. [from 1808]
(originally Hinduism) A phrase repeated to assist concentration during meditation. [from 1956]
examples: Hyponyms: gatha, om, om mani padme hum

entries.meaning: (by extension) A slogan or phrase often repeated.
